note_text:
HISTORY: The patient presented emergently to the bronchoscopy suite with acute respiratory distress and stridor immediately following a clinic visit. 
PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy was performed without sedation due to the acuity of the event. Topical anesthesia was achieved with 1% lidocaine. Upon insertion, a dense mucus plug was visualized obstructing the trachea and was successfully aspirated. Further examination revealed the left mainstem stent was partially occluded (approx. 50%) by tenacious secretions. Thorough suctioning was performed, restoring stent patency to 95%.
IMPRESSION: Acute airway obstruction secondary to mucus plugging, resolved with therapeutic aspiration.

Procedure: Emergency Flexible Bronchoscopy
Indication: Choking/Respiratory Distress
Sedation: None (Emergent)
Steps:
1. Lidocaine applied to nares/cords.
2. Scope inserted.
3. Large mucus plug identified in trachea -> Suctioned.
4. Left mainstem stent inspected; found 50% occluded with mucus.
5. Stent suctioned clear (95% patent).
6. Patient stabilized.

The bronchoscope was introduced, immediately identifying a large mucus plug within the trachea which was cleared. We continued to the left side, where the existing left mainstem stent was noted to be significantly obstructed by thick secretions. We performed extensive suctioning, effectively recanalizing the stent to near-total patency. The patient's breathing improved markedly immediately following the intervention.

note_text:
Indication: Lung nodules.
Technique: Robotic Bronchoscopy (Ion), rEBUS, CBCT.
Targets:
1. Lingula (LB4): 1cm nodule. rEBUS eccentric. Fiducial placed. TBNA x4, TBBX x1, Cryo x6, Brush, BAL.
2. LUL Anterior (LB3): 1cm nodule. rEBUS eccentric. TBNA x6, BAL. Cryo attempted/failed.
EBUS: Stations 4L, 7 inspected (benign). No sampling.
ROSE: Malignant.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of fiducial markers
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s)

lines.selection_reason: Primary procedure (highest RVU). Fiducials placed in Lingula.
TBNA performed in LUL (covering both Lingula and Anterior segment targets).
TBLB/Cryobiopsy performed in Lingula. Distinct from TBNA in LUL Anterior. Modifier 59 justifies separate reporting despite same lobe logic given distinct lesions.
Clearance of mucus from central airways (RMS, BI, LMS), distinct from biopsy sites.
Robotic navigation initiated and used for both targets.
Radial EBUS used for peripheral lesion localization.

global_comments: Targets in Lingula (LB4) and LUL Anterior (LB3) are anatomically in the same lobe (Left Upper Lobe).
Strict coding allows only one 'Initial' code per lobe. Therefore, +31633 (TBNA addl lobe) and +31632 (TBLB addl lobe) are NOT supported as both targets are LUL.
31629 (TBNA) covers sampling in the LUL. 31628 (TBLB) covers the cryobiopsy/forceps in the Lingula.
NCCI allows 31628 and 31629 in the same lobe with a modifier if distinct services. Given two distinct lesions were treated with different modalities, both are reported.
Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622), Brushing (31623), and BAL (31624) are bundled into the therapeutic biopsy codes.
EBUS (Linear) was inspection only with no sampling; 31622 covers inspection and is bundled. No 31652/53 generated.
Cone Beam CT (77012/76377) and TXA instillation are typically facility charges or bundled; excluded from professional fee calculation here to ensure compliance.

per_code.summary: Fiducial markers placed in Lingula. Highest valued code in the family.
TBNA performed in LUL (Lingula and Anterior segments).
Transbronchial biopsy (Forceps/Cryo) performed in Lingula. Reported with modifier 59 to distinguish from TBNA in same lobe.
Therapeutic aspiration of mucus from central airways (RMS, BI, LMS), distinct from the LUL targets.

metadata.notes: Generated from clinical note. User provided codes 31632/31633 were dropped due to anatomical bundling (Lingula is part of LUL).

changes: Retained 31628 and 31629 (distinct targets Lingula vs LUL Anterior, same lobe, 59 justified).

note_text: OPERATIVE SUMMARY: The patient underwent robotic-assisted navigational bronchoscopy for evaluation of bilateral pulmonary nodules. The Ion platform was utilized. Target 1 (Lingula) was localized via radial EBUS (eccentric view) and Cone Beam CT. Transbronchial needle aspiration, forceps biopsy, cryobiopsy, and brushing were performed. A fiducial marker was deployed. Target 2 (LUL Anterior) was similarly localized; TBNA and BAL were obtained. Linear EBUS inspection of stations 4L and 7 revealed benign sonographic features; no nodal sampling was required.

note_text:
Resident Procedure Note
Procedure: Ion Robotic Bronchoscopy, EBUS.
Targets: Lingula & LUL Anterior.
Steps:
1. EBUS inspection 4L, 7 (benign, not sampled).
2. Ion navigation to Lingula nodule. rEBUS eccentric.
3. Biopsies: Needle, Forceps, Cryo, Brush.
4. Fiducial placed in Lingula.
5. Nav to LUL Anterior. rEBUS eccentric.
6. Biopsies: Needle only. Cryo failed.
7. ROSE: Malignant.

ROSE consistent with malignancy.

note_text: The patient was placed under general anesthesia for evaluation of lung nodules. We began with linear EBUS, inspecting stations 4L and 7, which appeared benign and were not sampled. We then utilized the Ion robotic platform to navigate to a nodule in the Lingula. Confirmation was achieved with radial EBUS and Cone Beam CT. We obtained samples via needle, forceps, cryoprobe, and brush, and placed a fiducial marker. We then navigated to a second target in the LUL anterior segment, obtaining needle aspirates. ROSE confirmed malignancy.

note_text:
Indication: Lung nodules.
Procedure: Robotic navigation and sampling.
Details: The Lingula lesion was localized. We sampled it using needle, forceps, and cryoprobe. A marker was deployed. The LUL anterior lesion was then engaged and aspirated with a needle. Linear EBUS was used to visualize mediastinal nodes, which were not sampled due to benign appearance.

note_text: OPERATIVE REPORT: The patient presented for evaluation of a 1.5 cm RLL nodule. Robotic navigation (Ion) was utilized to localize the target in the posterior-basal segment (RB10). Radial EBUS showed a concentric view. We performed extensive sampling including TBNA, forceps biopsy, cryobiopsy, and brushing. A fiducial marker was deployed. Staging was performed via linear EBUS with TBNA of stations 7, 11L, and 11Rs.

note_text: We performed a combined robotic bronchoscopy and EBUS procedure. The EBUS scope was used first to sample lymph node stations 7, 11L, and 11Rs for staging. We then switched to the Ion robotic catheter, navigating to the target lesion in the right lower lobe. Once localized with radial EBUS and cone beam CT, we obtained diagnostic tissue using a variety of tools including needle, forceps, and cryoprobe. A fiducial marker was placed at the site prior to withdrawal.

note_text:
Indication: Pulmonary nodule.
Procedure: Robotic navigation and nodal staging.
Actions: We navigated to the RLL lesion. The lesion was sampled via needle, forceps, cryo, and brush. A marker was deployed. We then staged the mediastinum by aspirating nodes at stations 7, 11L, and 11Rs.

equipment.bronchoscope_model: Flexible Therapeutic Bronchoscope, Linear EBUS, Radial EBUS, Ion Robotic Bronchoscope

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Airway inspection performed. Mucus cleaned out from Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem.

therapeutic_aspiration.location: Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, Left Mainstem

linear_ebus_stations_detail.notes: 11Rs sampled. < 10 mm on CT. Type 2 elastography.

navigation_targets.notes: Ion robotic catheter advanced to 1.0 cm from target. Cios Spin CBCT used for confirmation.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Solitary Lung Nodule, Suspicious for malignancy
outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Follow up in clinic and CXR

note_text:
Indication: Lung infiltrates (Sarcoid?).
Procedure: Flex Bronch + EBUS.
Findings: Mucosa nodular (NBI).
Actions:
- BAL RML.
- EBBX: RUL, RML, Lingula carinas.
- Radial EBUS LLL: Concentric.
- TBBX LLL (LB10).
- Linear EBUS: Station 7 sampled (8 passes). 11R/11L inspected.
Result: Stable.

note_text: PROCEDURE NOTE: Bronchoscopy was performed for evaluation of suspected sarcoidosis. Airway inspection with NBI revealed diffuse nodular changes. Endobronchial biopsies were taken from the RUL, RML, and Lingula carinas. BAL was performed in the RML. Radial EBUS was used to localize a target in the LLL, followed by transbronchial forceps biopsies. Linear EBUS was utilized to inspect stations 4R, 4L, 7, 10R, 10L, 11R, 11L. Only station 7 met criteria for sampling and was biopsied via TBNA.

note_text: Mr. Smith underwent bronchoscopy for evaluation of lung infiltrates. We noted nodular mucosal changes and performed endobronchial biopsies at multiple carinas. A bronchoalveolar lavage was conducted in the right middle lobe. We then directed our attention to the left lower lobe, using radial EBUS to guide transbronchial biopsies. Finally, we performed EBUS staging, sampling the subcarinal node (station 7) while inspecting other stations which did not require biopsy.
